Cerita Siswi SMAN 1 Tenggarong Menembus Juara 1 LCC Empat Pilar
03 Nov 2019, 16:10 by Alfi Kholisdinuka
Jakarta - Perjuangan memang tidak pernah mengkhianati hasil. Ungkapan sederhana yang terbilang magis ini seringkali menjadi doa bagi tiap orang dalam mewujudkan berbagai impian. Seperti halnya, Assyifa Idnu Rahmah siswi kelas 11 SMAN 1 Tenggarong dari Provinsi Kalimantan Timur.
Assyifa bersama dengan rekan-rekannya datang jauh-jauh ke Jakarta untuk mengikuti Lomba Cerdas Cermat (LCC) Empat Pilar yang diadakan oleh Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat (MPR). Tujuannya hanya satu untuk meraih juara sehingga dapat membanggakan sekolah serta kedua orang tuanya.
Dia pun berusaha semaksimal mungkin. Tidak tanggung-tanggung, Assyifa bersama rekannya mempersiapkannya sejak satu tahun sebelum acara LCC dilaksanakan. Beragam materi seputar empat pilar dia perdalam agar dapat mengasah kemampuannya di lantai lomba cerdas cermat ini.
"Ya kami mempersiapkannya sejak setahun yang lalu. Setiap pulang sekolah kami tidak bermain, hanya belajar dan bimbingan setiap hari sampai Minggu. Pas waktu liburan bulan puasa juga kami korbankan untuk belajar, waktu liburan kenaikan kelas tahun lalu juga kami pakai untuk belajar dan mengikuti seleksi ini," kata Syifa saat ditemui selepas acara di Komplek Senayan, Jakarta, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Meski hal itu sangat melelahkan, Syifa tidak pantang menyerah, semangatnya terus bergelora demi sebuah mimpi dan harapan yang perlu diraihnya. Berbagai metode pembelajaran yang dipelajari bersama kakak kelas dan guru pendamping dia terapkan.
"Metode nya kami coba menghafal pasal, menghafal materi-materi juga seputar amandemen uud, terus ya di-review setiap hari gitu. Kaka-kakanya yang sekarang kelas 12 juga membimbing kami gimana caranya saat perlombaan bisa bersikap tenang dan menjawab dengan baik," terangnya.
Perjuangan itu pun sedikit demi sedikit membuahkan hasil yang baik. Untuk dapat mengikuti tahap nasional ini, Syifa bersama rekan sekolahnya berhasil lolos tiga seleksi yakni tingkat kecamatan, tingkat kabupaten, tingkat provinsi, hingga pada akhirnya tingkat nasional.
Di tingkat nasional ini dia menghadapi sekolah yang terbilang menguasai berbagai materi seputar empat pilar, seperti SMAN 2 Sampit Kalimantan Timur dan SMAN 1 Brebes.
Beruntung berkat pemahaman pembelajaran yang lebih baik, Assyifa bersama rekannya di SMAN 1 Tenggarong berhasil mengungguli lomba cerdas cermat ini. Sehingga membawa nama SMAN 1 Tenggarong menjadi juara 1 tingkat nasional dan berhak membawa uang tunaik sebesar Rp 50 juta.
Assyifa pun menuturkan kegembiraan dan harapannya semoga perjuangan yang ia lakukan bersama SMAN 1 Tenggarong ini dapat memberikan dampak yang baik bagi pelajar di Indonesia agar bisa mewujudkan keinginannya dan cita-citanya.
Sementara itu, saat ditanya soal harapan terhadap kurikulum pendidikan saat ini dengan adanya Mendikbud baru yakni Nadiem Makariem. Ia berharap semoga dapat merubah tatanansistem pembelajaran di Indonesia lebih baik sehingga semakin banyak pelajar yang berprestasi.
"Semoga (Mendikbud Nadiem) bisa bikin sistem pendidikan Indonesia untuk pelajar bisa lebih mengerti dan cepat memahami pelajaran. Saya harap kurikulumnya juga lebih baik sehingga meningkatkan prestasi pelajar di Indonesia," jelasnya.

Story of SMAN 1 Tenggarong Students Penetrating 1st Place in Four Pillars LCC
03 Nov 2019, 16:10 by Alfi Kholisdinuka
Jakarta - The struggle has never betrayed the results. This simple phrase that is fairly magical is often a prayer for everyone in realizing various dreams. As is the case, Assyifa Idnu Rahmah, a class 11 student at SMAN 1 Tenggarong from East Kalimantan Province.
Assyifa along with her colleagues came all the way to Jakarta to take part in the Four Pillars of Intelligence Competition (LCC) held by the People's Consultative Assembly (MPR). The goal is only one to win the championship so that they can boast of the school and their parents.
He also tried as much as possible. No half-hearted, Assyifa and her colleagues prepare it since one year before the LCC event was held. Various materials around the four pillars he deepened in order to hone his skills on the floor of this quiz contest.
"Yes, we prepared it since a year ago. Every time we go home from school we don't play, we only study and provide guidance every day until Sunday. When we go to the fasting month holidays, we also sacrifice for our class holidays last year and we use it to study and participate in the selection. this, "said Syifa when met after the event at the Senayan Complex, Jakarta, Sunday (3/11/2019).
Although it was very tiring, Syifa did not give up, her enthusiasm continued to surge for a dream and hope that needed to be achieved. He applied a variety of learning methods with classmates and teacher assistants.
"The method we try to memorize the article, memorizing the material is also about the amendments of the uud, then yes it is reviewed every day. So, his brother who is now 12th grade also guides us on how to do it when the race can be calm and answer well," he explained .
The struggle was gradually producing good results. To be able to take part in this national stage, Syifa and her school partners managed to pass three selections, namely the sub-district level, the district level, the provincial level, and finally the national level.
At the national level, he faces a school that is fairly familiar with a variety of materials around four pillars, such as SMAN 2 Sampit East Kalimantan and SMAN 1 Brebes.
Luckily thanks to a better understanding of learning, Assyifa and her colleagues at SMAN 1 Tenggarong succeeded in surpassing this quiz contest. So that brought the name of SMAN 1 Tenggarong to become the national champion in the first place and entitled to bring a cash prize of Rp. 50 million.
Assyifa also expressed her joy and hope that the struggle she had undertaken with SMAN 1 Tenggarong could have a good impact on students in Indonesia in order to realize their desires and aspirations.
Meanwhile, when asked about the expectations of the current education curriculum with the new Minister of Education and Culture namely Nadiem Makariem. He hopes that he can change the learning system in Indonesia better so that more students will excel.
"Hopefully (Minister of Education and Culture Nadiem) can make the Indonesian education system for students can better understand and quickly understand the lesson. I hope the curriculum is also better so that it improves student achievement in Indonesia," he explained.
